author: The Editorial Board
title: The U.N.’s Syria Debacle
text:
When the United Nations Security Council called for a 30-day humanitarian cease-fire in Syria on Feb. 24, it expressed “outrage at the insufficient implementation of its resolutions 2139 (2014), 2165 (2014), 2191 (2014), 2258 (2015), 2268 (2016), 2332 (2016) and 2393 (2017).” You’ll never guess how Resolution 2401 is working out.
On Monday the first humanitarian aid convoys since November rolled into rebel-held areas in the Damascus suburbs to deliver medical supplies, food and nutritional supplements to besieged civilians...
